cyclone.name: NESTOR
cyclone.current_location: about 85 miles SW of Apalachicola, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating northeast toward the Florida Panhandle, then across GA/SC and offshore the North Carolina coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Panhandle near Apalachicola–Panama City, FL

weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning on the Gulf coast from Navarre FL to Yankeetown FL (not including Port Canaveral)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Panhandle and Big Bend, then Atlantic coast from northern Florida through the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Brief periods of 25–35 mph gusts possible Saturday as outer bands skirt east-central Florida
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Atlantic side at Port Canaveral
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches with locally higher amounts could cause minor flooding around the port Saturday–early Sunday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornado risk in rain bands over central Florida on 19 Oct
